posts.post_content:
An M12 Pre-release true story:  
Opponent's turn: Opponent has 2 life playing R/B. I have 18 playing G/R deck. She has Chandra M12 with 3 loyalty and some chump blockers while I have Garruk M12 with 1 loyalty, a tapped arachnus spinner and a stampeding rhino with summoning sickness. I have a reclaim, blood ogre and act of treason in hand. She has no cards in hand.  
  
I plan to play reclaim on a fireball at end of her turn.  
  
Turn starts, she draws a card. She casts [Sorin's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin's Vengeance) with Chandra's 2nd ability triggered. GG. Just like that.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@ psyklone  
  
You can't do that, the last ability is the same as [Hex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hex) (EXCEPT for one important thing)  
  
Like Hex you must target 6 different targets and each of them get 6. You must have 6 different targets to use the last ability.  
  
EXCEPT it says up to, so instead of needing 6 targets like Hex, you can choose 1-6 targets, but they each must be different still
posts.html:
@ psyklone

You can't do that, the last ability is the same as Hex (EXCEPT for one important thing)

EXCEPT it says up to, so instead of needing 6 targets like Hex, you can choose 1-6 targets, but they each must be different still

posts.post_content:
I don't know how I went this long without realizing it, but the updated oracle text on Flashback specifically says "cast" now. We haven't seen many Innistrad spoilers with Flashback yet (only 45 non-lands all told I believe), but something like turn 4 Chandra and ping, turn 5 [Moan of the Unhallowed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moan of the Unhallowed) duplicated for four 2/2 zombies, turn 6 ping, 7 flashback [Moan of the Unhallowed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moan of the Unhallowed) for four more 2/2 zombies and Chandra's still alive (if she hasn't been hit) is some really spectacular board advantage. Even lackluster cards like [Silent Departure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silent Departure) (sorcery [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon) with a {4}{U} Flashback) could be legitimate if run alongside Chandra. At least if the game tempo actually slows down as much as it's looking like it should with Innistrad rotating in and Zendikar/M11 rotating out. If it doesn't, then these plays are decidedly less practical, but still probably usable.  
  
So far, the best flashback card to use alon... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I don't know how I went this long without realizing it, but the updated oracle text on Flashback specifically says "cast" now. We haven't seen many Innistrad spoilers with Flashback yet (only 45 non-lands all told I believe), but something like turn 4 Chandra and ping, turn 5 Moan of the Unhallowed duplicated for four 2/2 zombies, turn 6 ping, 7 flashback Moan of the Unhallowed for four more 2/2 zombies and Chandra's still alive (if she hasn't been hit) is some really spectacular board advantage. Even lackluster cards like Silent Departure (sorcery Unsummon with a {4}{U} Flashback) could be legitimate if run alongside Chandra. At least if the game tempo actually slows down as much as it's looking like it should with Innistrad rotating in and Zendikar/M11 rotating out. If it doesn't, then these plays are decidedly less practical, but still probably usable.

posts.post_content:
Oh, thunder-thighs. <3. I love playing RDW and drawing 4 cards for 3 mana thanks to her and [Tezzeret's Gambit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret's Gambit)  
  
  
  
@diachronos comparing Chandra to Jace is a bit silly. Sure, they both started out at 3, but:  
1. Jace had +2 for a strong ability, whilst Chandra has +1 for an almost insignificant one.  
2. Jace had a 0 ability, again very strong, Chandra doesn't  
3. Jace had -1, Chandra has -2. So while you could have used Jace's -1 three times, you can only use this one once.   
4. jace's ultimate won the game, though it was often overkill at that point. Chandra's ultimate doesn't do much, and the game shouldn't last that long anyway.   
5. Jace was in blue, ergo had counters and many ways to keep him protected. Chandra is in red, which is highly vulnerable. Sure, no one's saying you can't splash her with blue to get this, but that in itself complicates the matter.   
  
So yes, it would have been preferable is Chandra started out at 4, or if she had the ability cost -1(since let... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

3. Jace had -1, Chandra has -2. So while you could have used Jace's -1 three times, you can only use this one once.
4. jace's ultimate won the game, though it was often overkill at that point. Chandra's ultimate doesn't do much, and the game shouldn't last that long anyway.
5. Jace was in blue, ergo had counters and many ways to keep him protected. Chandra is in red, which is highly vulnerable. Sure, no one's saying you can't splash her with blue to get this, but that in itself complicates the matter.

So yes, it would have been preferable is Chandra started out at 4, or if she had the ability cost -1(since let... (see all)
